```python
from scipy.optimize import linprog

def prob_270(smoothie, protein_bar):
    c = [-2, -7]  # Coefficients of the objective function to maximize 2x + 7y
    A = [[2, 7], [300, 250], [-2, 1]]  # Coefficients of the constraints
    b = [0, 2000, 0]  # Right-hand side of the constraints

    res = linprog(c, A_ub=A, b_ub=b)
    max_protein_intake = -res.fun  # Maximum protein intake

    return max_protein_intake

# Example usage
smoothie = 1
protein_bar = 2
max_protein_intake = prob_270(smoothie, protein_bar)
print("Maximum protein intake:", max_protein_intake)
```

This code uses the `linprog` function from the `scipy.optimize` module to solve the linear programming problem and maximize the protein intake while satisfying the given constraints. The function `prob_270` takes the number of smoothies and protein bars as input and returns the maximum protein intake achievable.
